description.narrative: The aim of this specific project is to further develop The Scaling-up Primary healthcare in Pastoralist areas of Afar and Somali Region, Ethiopia Project into a concrete proposal. The envisioned project is earmarked as a Federal Ministry of Health priority project that it wishes to develop in cooperation with the Embassy of the Kingdom of The Netherlands and the Netherlands Enterprise Agency. The project aims to establish and expand innovative healthcare services by establishing the next level of primary and mother and child health care to serve pastoral communities with integrated technologies and services for sustainable quality care. The project will link to the Health Sector Transformation Plan II goal: Achieve universal health coverage through a resilient primary health care system that effectively and efficiently responds to the needs of the peoples. The current health care infrastructure is still poor and/or insufficient. Through PSD Toolkit the first step in the development of a potential project can be taken that could overcome the above described shortcomings in the current health care provision in Afar and Somali Region and will finally result in a significant improvement of the health outcomes and in vulnerable population in Afar and Somali Region in general and women in particular. In addition the project will result in a healthier workforce and through that stimulate the development of thousands of small enterprises in these emerging regions.
